title: Grasshopper for Revit Manual and Cheat Sheet
author: Marcello Sgambelluri, PE, SE
description: A book with 200+ examples and workflows using side by side defintions on Grasshopper and Dynamo in Revit. A must for anyone that  Revit

title: Quick Course on Rhino/Grasshopper
author: Aussie BIM Guru
description: This video serves as a crash course to get you orientated into Rhino, Grasshopper and Revit.  This will help come to terms with the basic interface/functions to get you started with this integrated platform

title: 101 Class LiveAcademy
author: Oliver Thomas, BIG
description: In this 1-hour course Oliver Thomas from BIG will cover the basics of the Rhino.Inside interface, the components and workflow while working on a real-world project.

title: Online Rhino.Inside Revit Essentials
author: SimplyRhino
description: This live and online course is suitable for those within Architecture & Construction who find themselves using Rhino as well as Autodesk Revit® and are looking into ways to enhance the interoperability between the two.

title: Building Systems Specialist
author: PAZ Academy
description: 5 months personal online training for Architects, Engineers & BIM Modelers. Rhino, Grasshopper, Rhino.Inside.REVIT and much more fun.

title: Revit: Rhino Workflow Course
author: Olivia Morgan
description: Rhino and Revit both have a firm place in the architecture and construction workflow. Rhino is an ideal program to model complex forms for iterative conceptual projects while Revit excels in creating BIM driven projects with layers of information. In this course instructor Olivia Morgan shows you how to seamlessly move between these programs in a safe and practical workflow.

title: Complete Workshop for Inside.Revit
author: McNeel
description: A 3 hour workshop conducted by Scott Davidson and Ehsan Iran-Nejad from Robert McNeel & Associates at the Core Studio AECTech2020 conference.

title: Consulting, Training, Development for Rhino.Inside.Revit
author: Applied Software
description: Knowing where to start with this technology and how to implement it in your workflow can be intimidating. Our experts will provide a full organizational evaluation of your Rhino, Grasshopper, and Revit workflows and recommend the best practices moving forward.

title: Quick Tutorial
author: Oliver Thomas, BIG
description: Learn how to import geometry from Rhino into Revit using Rhino Inside. During this tutorial we will cover 3 methodologies to move geometry from Rhino into Revit!

title: Getting the most out of Rhino in BIM projects
author: Modelical
description: Webinar about the successful use of Rhino.Inside.Revit in several architectural projects at Modelical. Rhino.Inside.Revit is mainly well-known for its capacity of translating complex geometry from Rhino to Revit. Our speakers will show us how they manage both geometry and information and design optimal workflows.

title: Rhino.Inside.Revit Review
author: Håvard Vasshaug
description: A 5-star presentation from Håvard Vasshaug of the Bad Monkeys group to [Snøhetta](https://www.snohetta.com/). If you know Revit and want to know how your workflow might be improved, watch this

title: Rhino-to-Revit Workflows at Seattle SeaRUG
author: Joseph Fruend, Microsol @ Seattle Revit User Group
description: Microsol AEC Application Specialist Joseph Freund shows the Seattle Revit User's Group showing some features of Rhino.Inside Revit and Rhino 7, including Subd.

title: Structural Design with AKT II
author: Deyan Marzev and James Magbanua from AKT II London
description: Rhino3D Meeting with a focus on Rhino.Inside®.Revit. Featuring Engineers AKT II, and Rhino.Inside Developers from McNeel.

title: Grasshopper in a Revit Workflow
author: Jeffrey Pinheiro, AIA AKA The Revit Kid
description: The Revit Kid on BIM After Dark is joined by Marcello Sgambelluri.  They discuss both Grasshopper and Dynamo scripts in Revit. We will be talking about the book, showing some examples, and demonstrating how knowing BOTH of these tools expands the functionality of Revit for you. Discover how these tools can help your workflow.

title: Rhino Inside Revit with Ehsan
author: Jeffrey Pinheiro, AIA AKA The Revit Kid
description: On this episode of BIM After Dark Live Ehsan Iran Nejad returns to the show to talk about Rhino Inside Revit. Have you tried using Rhino and Revit TOGETHER? The truth is, for a long time it kind of sucked to try and use them together... That is, until Rhino.Inside.Revit came along.

title: Conveyor and Rhino.Inside.Revit Explained
author: Nathan Miller @ Proving Ground
description: We often get asked how Conveyor is different than Rhino.Inside Revit - the good news is that they are designed to work together!

title: BIMThoughts Rhino.Inside.Revit
author: BIMThoughts
description: Scott Davidson and Ehsan discuss Rhino.Inside.Revit with the BIMThoughts crew

title: BIMxt Rhino.Inside.Revit
author: BIMxt Network
description: Scott Davidson and Ehsan present Rhino.Inside.Revit at the BIMxt Network event

title: AECbytes Rhino.Inside.Revit
author: AECBytes Blog
description: A 5-star presentation from Håvard Vasshaug of the Bad Monkeys group to [Snøhetta](https://www.snohetta.com/). If you know Revit and want to know how your workflow might be improved, watch this

title: Changing AEC w/ Nate Miller
author: Marcello Sgambelluri, PE, SE
description: In this episode John Pierson and Marcello talk to Nate Miller about Grasshopper, Dynamo, Conveyor and more.

title: Parametric Monkey Primer
author: Paul Wintour @ Parametric Monkey
description: With the release of Rhino.Inside.Revit, a whole range of new interoperability possibilities now exist. We've been working with our clients to integrate Grasshopper scripts with Revit, and developed this quick tutorial to help them get up and running. Hopefully it helps you too

title: Exploring Rhino.Inside Revit Together
author: 7fold Design Technology
description: We walk through setting up Rhino.Inside for the first time and exploring the feature set. Full disclosure this is like an unboxing for me and I want to encourage you to join me in the conversation as we figure out what's new!

title: Rhino.Inside.Revit Happy Hour Webinar
author: Marcello Sgambelluri, PE, SE
description: Marcello shows Rhino.Inside.Revit. That's right, you can run Rhino (and Grasshopper) inside of Revit. Hosted by [The Revit Kid](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC6TtKCInvnoU7vLNACZRFrQ)

title: Rhino + Revit with Gavin Crump
author: Revit Pure Live and The Aussie BIM Guru
description: Learn the best practices and optimal workflows to make Rhino and Revit work together. For today's show, none other than the legendary Gavin Crump of the great Aussie BIM Guru YouTube channel will be joining Revit Pure Live.

title: Efficient modelmaking with Rhino.Inside.Revit.
author: Olivia Morgan
description: BIMThoughts crew chats with Olivia Morgan, the founder of Model Space about all things model making. We cover 3D printing, get a Revit model ready for 3D printing, how awesome Rhino.Inside.Revit is so much more! Be sure to listen to the end to get all of Olivia’s Hot Tips for model making!

title: Cutting Edge Hack: Grasshopper & Dynamo working together within Revit
author: Marcello Sgambelluri, PE, SE
description: Marcello shows Rhino.Inside.Revit. Learn how to make Grasshopper Designs and Dynamo Productions work together with Revit using new tech and new attitudes

title: Software you need to know in 2021
author: Stephen Drew, Architecture Social
description: Here are Stephen Drew's thoughts on what Architecture Software you need to learn NOW which will give you an advantage and accelerate your career in 2021.

title: BIMThoughts on Rhino.Inside.Revit and PyRevit
author: BIMThoughts Podcast
description: In this episode we chat with the very busy Ehsan Iran-Nejad about his amazing add-in for Revit call pyRevit. We also chat with Ehsan about his work at McNeel on the Rhino.Inside.Revit integration.

title: Aussie BIM Guru Video Series on Rhino.Inside.Revit
author: Gavin Crump
description: Gavin Crump kicks off a series on Rhino.Inside.Revit with a 5 part series - the new tool which connects Rhino and Revit together! Gavin thinks Grasshopper in Revit is a massive breakthrough for computational designers. In this first part, he covers how to bake out elements from Revit into Rhino using filtering criteria. In the next parts we will cover reading and setting parameter values in Revit

title: First Look at Element Binding
author: 7fold Design Technology
description: Take a first look at the improved workflow in Rhino Inside that maintains a persistent connection to elements created in Revit such as walls, levels, grids, adaptive components, and more. This new feature is referred to as 'element binding' and is an essential stepping stone to collaborating with colleagues with Rhino Inside. No more re-generating model elements by accident the moment you open up a script for the first time.

title: How-to-Rhino Tutorial
author: How to Rhino Facebook Group
description: This is a short recap of Rhino.Inside.Revit plugin which allows Revit and other apps to run Rhino and Grasshopper within Revit application. Keep in mind that this works only with Rhino 7 work in progress version. With this plugin, you can easily import and export geometry from Revit to Rhino and Grasshopper and the other way around. As this is a native McNeel development tool, it is going to be a game changer when it comes to having the ability to use parametric modeling techniques in Grasshopper and have all of that work seamlessly in a BIM tool such as Revit

title: Selecting Rhino elements by Revit properties by the Aussie BIM Guru
author: Gavin Crump
description: Using a data rich Rhino model, we can mine this data to select elements the same way we could in Revit - Rhivit, pwhoah!

title: Becoming a computational designer with Rhino.Inside.Revit
author: The Creative Insider Podcast
description: Olly Thomas is a BIM Specialist at BIG New York. Olly is also part of the international architectural collective PIXELS Among all the activities he does he also educates people about parametrical design and BIM and how to make your ideas buildable.

title: SF Computational Design Institute presentation of Rhino.Inside.Revit
author: San Francisco Computational Design Institute
description: This is a short recap of Rhino.Inside.Revit plugin and Compute technology in Rhino

title: AIA Detroit co.de.D Rhino.Inside.Revit Presentation
author: AIA Detroit co.DE.D Group
description: Rhino.Inside allows you to use Grasshopper directly within Revit. Will this replace Dynamo or enhance it? Join co.de.D as we discuss what Rhino.Inside means for our industry

title: Rhino to Revit Automated
author: Nathan Miller @ Proving Ground
description: This webinar provides an early preview of Conveyor V3. Conveyor v3 introduces NEW features and workflows to further streamline Rhino-Revit integration. In this webinar, Nathan Miller will discuss the capabilities of Conveyor v3 and how the tools support users of any skill level... no coding or Grasshopper skills required!

title: Using Conveyer with Rhino.Inside
author: Nathan Miller @ Proving Ground
description: This tutorial reviews two ways that the same Grasshopper definition  can integrate with Revit using the Conveyor V2 plugin.

title: Direct Send Rhino Objects to Revit with Conveyor
author: Nathan Miller @ Proving Ground
description: The Conveyor plugin extends and enhances Rhino 7's Rhino.Inside.Revit technology for a more integrated and easy workflow.

title: Get Revit Walls into Rhino with Conveyor
author: Nathan Miller @ Proving Ground
description: This tutorial describes the process for getting Revit objects - such as walls - into Rhino 7 using the Conveyor V2 plugin.

title: Transfer Rhino to Revit
author: McNeel
description: This is a complete guide on transfering your Rhino models to Revit in a BIM friendly way. Learn how to encode Rhino shapes and forms Revit elements.

title: Create Column Family and insert along a Curve
author: McNeel
description: This sample shows how to create a new Revit family that contains geometry created in Rhino and Grasshopper

title: Custom Casework Inspired by Renzo Piano using Rhino.Inside for Revit
author: 7fold Design Technology
description: This workflow uses Grasshopper to model custom casework inspired by Renzo Piano's design at the Jerome Seydoux Pathe Foundation in Paris.

title: Creating Wall in Revit
author: McNeel
description: This sample shows how to take normal Rhino curve and create a set of Revit system family walls

title: Creating Walls Tutorial
author: How to Rhino
description: We will also go over a couple of simple Grasshopper definitions that will be used to create walls directly in Revit. You will learn how to completely control the walls component for Rhino Inside and we will use Enscape together with Revit.

title: Creating Windows
author: How To Rhino
description: In this Rhino Inside Revit tutorial, we’re going to create windows in Revit based on geometry input from Rhino and Grasshopper. This method allows the use of both parametric and manual positioning for our families that are being created directly from Grasshopper

title: Intro to Rhino.Inside.Revit
author: Rethinking BIM
description: This video provides an intro to some of the capabilities of Rhino.Inside.Revit

title: EvolveLAB covers Rhino.Inside.Revit - Way Faster Wednesday
author: EvolveLAB
description: In this video, we highlight the power of Rhino.Inside.Revit with Grasshopper. We will place adaptive components and floors using rhino inside with grasshopper

title: Transfer Revit to Rhino
author: McNeel
description: This sample shows how to take Revit objects into Rhino

title: Proving Ground Rhino Revit Add-ons
author: Nathan Miller @ Proving Ground
description: This webinar will be a PREVIEW of new capabilities that expand the data-driven pipeline between Rhino, Revit, and Power BI.

title: Solar Analysis with Rhino.Inside.Revit
author: Paul Wintour @ Parametric Monkey
description: One of the most frequent requests I receive is about running solar access analysis within Revit. Despite the fact that it is still quicker and more accurate to export to Grasshopper, run the analysis and push the results back, many still prefer to stay within Revit. So I decided to do a quick proof-of-concept and I'm proud to announce that it works perfectly using Rhino.Inside.Revit

title: Lands Design running inside Revit
author: Lands Design
description: In this video, you see how a landscape project that has been modeled with Lands Design, can be opened and modified in Revit. All BIM objects in Lands Design can be recognized as Revit corresponding objects. This video introduces a powerful BIM solution for landscape design in Revit.

title: VisualARQ running Rhino.Inside
author: VisualARQ
description: This video shows a sneak preview of VisualARQ 3 version (WIP- Work in progress), running inside Revit using Rhino.Inside technology, available in Rhino 7 (WIP)

title: Grasshopper BIM objects with VisualARQ
author: VisualARQ
description: This video tutorial shows how to work with the VisualARQ Grasshopper styles (VisualARQ objects driven by Grasshopper definitions), running VisualARQ inside Revit. This way, you can work with the VisualARQ parametric objects, and generate them in Revit automatically as Revit Furniture object types. This connection is possible with the VisualARQ Grasshopper components.

title: Auto-update Revit Sheets Using Grasshopper
author: 7fold Design Technology
description: Join me in this Rhino.Inside tutorial as we walk through setting up automated sheet management for Revit driven by the floor plan type placed on each sheet.

title: Room Data and View Analysis with Rhino.Inside.Revit
author: Rethinking BIM
description: This video goes through a workflow that uses Rhino.Inside and the View Rose tool in Ladybug (Grasshopper plugin) in order to demonstrate the process of running a geometry-focused analysis in Rhino/Grasshopper and feeding results back into a Revit parameter

title: Floor Finish by Room using Grasshopper
author: BIMGeek
description: When room finishes are defined or embedded in a room's parameter, it doesn't make any sense to model floor finishes manually. We are going to create floor finishes from room boundaries using Grasshopper inside Revit.

title: Check Fire Rating of Doors and Walls
author: BIMGeek
description: In this tutorial I compared fire rating values of doors and their host walls. Then filtered doors that doesn’t have the same value as their host element. This was fairly simple example to demonstrate how to filter Revit data in Grasshopper.

title: Closest grid intersection to Revit elements
author: Gavin Crump
description: Use Grasshopper to find the closest grid intersections to elements in a Revit model. Time to blow it out of the water by using Rhino Inside Revit!

title: Revit rooms to Rhino using Rhino Inside
author: Gavin Crump
description: Rooms are very important when dealing with analysis workflows in Revit/Rhino projects. In this video I'll run through my workflow I typically use to cleanly migrate room shapes and their data to Rhino from Revit.

title: Project Objects to Topography
author: BIMGeek
description: The topic of this tutorial will be the projection of components into given topography. This is a task that can be automated easily with a simple script.

title: Place Objects Randomly into a Topography
author: BIMGeek
description: I created a tutorial on placing objects randomly on a topography using Grasshopper inside Revit and created a forest model as an example case.

title: How to Automate Setting Revit Materials Per Panel
author: 7fold Design Technology
description: This complete workflow shows you how to take existing panels in your architecture design model and swap out the materials for each family instance.

title: Geometry Gym with Rhino.Inside.Revit
author: Geometry Gym
description: This video runs through the basics of Rhino.Inside.Revit and how to get up and running with this exciting new technology. Along with Geometry Gym tools with an eye toward facades and structures

title: Place Beams in Rhino.Inside.Revit
author: Marcello Sgambelluri @ Simply Complex Podcast
description: In this video I show you how to simplify Revit structural beam modeling using an adaptive component and Rhino.Inside.Revit

title: Clash Detection with Rhino.Inside.Revit
author: PointOneStudio
description: In this video, I will introduce to make clash detection using RhinoInside for Revit.

title: Structural drawings, Calculations & Model from Architectural design
author: Structured Parametrics
description: An example of modern parametric workflow for structural engineering. Takes Architectural concept through to structural model, calculations and drawings. Modern workflows can cut engineering time to a fraction of traditional methods allowing responsive collaboration with others.

title: Analytical Model Manipulation
author: McNeel
description: This example takes a look at working with Revit analytical models using Rhino.Inside.Revit

title: Structural framing from Grasshopper to Revit
author: Structured Parametrics
description: Tutorial on how to get Grasshopper structural framing into Revit with Rhino.Inside. This shows how quick it can be to get framing into Revit but also shows some of the issues with the current workflow for this Work In Progress project.

title: Craft clean structural models
author: Structured Parametrics
description: We demo new techniques for stripping haphazard or messy Architectural information and converting it to high quality structural models and drawings.

title: Clash Detection, Grasshopper player, SubD, Rhino.Inside.Revit
author: Structured Parametrics
description: Rhino 7 has been released! See a quick preview of new features with a focus on what will be useful for Engineers.

title: Optimizing your Workflow in Rhino-to-Revit
author: Joseph Fruend, Microsol @ Philadelphia Dynamo User Group
description: Microsol AEC Application Specialist Joseph Freund will share tips and tricks for a seamless Rhino-to-Revit workflow, eliminating needless importing/exporting so that models can be cleanly integrated into the final production environment.

title: Building Shell using Adaptive Components
author: McNeel
description: This sample shows how to how to drive adaptive components using Grasshopper and Rhino

title: Create a Simple Revit Adaptive Component for use in Rhino Inside
author: 7fold Design Technology
description: Learn how to create parametric offset relationships for this family that can be used for paneling, rationalizing architecture facade designs, and in connection with Rhino Inside Grasshopper scripts for modeling in Revit.

title: Use Grasshopper to Model 3 Revit Adaptive Component Types by an Image
author: 7fold Design Technology
description: Using Rhino Inside for Revit learn how to model adaptive components dynamically with Grasshopper. This is a great method for understanding how to organize data in Grasshopper into multiple groups.

title: Custom Revit region with Rhino
author: Junghwo Park @ PointOneStudio
description: PointOneStudio shows how to create complex hatch for revit by using Rhino's Hatch Maker plug-in.

title: Adaptive Components driven by Ladybug/Grasshopper
author: Rethinking BIM
description: This tutorial demonstrates the process of placing an adaptive component and assigning a parameter value to that component using geometry and analysis data generated in Grasshopper.

title: Rename Multiple Revit Models Levels with RhinoInside and Excel Data
author: Junghwo Park @ PointOneStudio
description: PointOneStudio introduces a workflow of automatically updating the level names and heights of Revits domain models using RhinoInside and Excel Data.

title: Parametric Twisting Tower with Rhino.Inside.Revit
author: Lorenzo Lencioni and Alberto Nann
description: The potential of a parametric modeling software like Grasshopper is undeniable, like those of Building Information Modeling BIM offered by Revit.

title: Getting User Input using Human UI
author: McNeel
description: The example here requires the [HumanUI plugin for Grasshopper](https://www.food4rhino.com/app/human-ui). This is a plugin allowing Grasshopper to design and display dialog box interfaces. In this case the dialog interface will help edit the *Drawn by* and the *Checked by* sections of the title block

title: Roof From Wall Edges
author: McNeel
description: This sample shows how to Select Revit Element edges as input to a Grasshopper lofted surface. Using Revit objects as input to Grasshopper definitions allows for a dynamic editing directly in Revit and making Grasshopper interactive within the the Revit model

title: Extract Window Geometry and Material by Sub-Categories
author: McNeel
description: The first part of this definition, collects subcategories available on *Windows Category* in the active document

title: Update Door Marks
author: McNeel
description: This sample shows how to updated properties on Revit elements
